snippet: Banks across the country are reluctant to provide services to marijuana businesses, fearing that federal regulators and law enforcement authorities might punish them.
abstract: Banks nationwide are reluctant to provide services to marijuana businesses, fearing that federal regulators and law enforcement authorities might punish them; situation leaves legal marijuana merchants in states like Colorado and Washington to grapple with conducting their businesses almost entirely in cash; underscores problem of patchwork federal and state laws that have evolved fitfully as states have legalized some form of marijuana commerce.
lead_paragraph: Banks across the country are reluctant to provide services to marijuana businesses, fearing that federal regulators and law enforcement authorities might punish them.

headline.main: Banks Say No to Marijuana Money, Legal or Not
headline.print_headline: Banks Say No to Marijuana Money, Legal or Not
